reviewText: Whether you're an avid fan of DOG THE BOUNTY HUNTER or a complete newcomer, DOG THE BOUNTY HUNTER: BEST OF SEASON 2 is a top recommendation, gathering the best of the reality show's second season episodes - seven favorites selected by the Dog himself - from the series. For newcomers: there are other reality TV shows on bail-jumpers; but DOG comes with many differences. First, the posse is large-sized, heavily tattooed, and located in Hawaii, the island associated with peace and not crime. Second, the posse is deeply religious: a belief which extends to their actions as they capture bail-jumpers then embark on the brief roots of a conversion to a better life. Third, it's a family affair. Add a dose of humor to this unlikely mix of a family of bounty hunters and you have a riveting show which has just enough outside the norm of crime/police shows to keep audiences on their toes - and cognizant of the importance of adding social consciousness to the justice system, which is Dog's forte.Diane C. Donovan, EditorCalifornia Bookwatch
summary: A riveting show which has just enough outside the norm of crime/police shows to keep audiences on their toes

reviewText: You seen one episode you seen them all. Dog and crew chase small time criminals and get their friends and family to rat them out. Dog calls the criminal scum and claims that he is fighting the war on ice, but keeps bailing drug dealers out of jail even after they jumped bond on him. Anything for a buck I guess.
